notes: Sound Blaster Pro and earlier cards do not always decode the least significant bit of the I/O port. Even numbered I/O ports that do not have an explicit odd numbered port will alias the even numbered port at both even and odd numbers
DOSLIB testing reveals that ESS AudioDrive chipsets faithfully emulate the DSP alias at SB_BASE+0xD

notes.text: There is a known test case of a demo that {italic:requires} the aliased DSP write command/data port at SB_BASE+0xD to work (it will hang at startup otherwise): {weblink:url=https://www.pouet.net/prod.php?which=6171,text=EMF Intro by Electromotive Force (1991)}

Sound Blaster 2.0 through Pro cards return 0xAA/0x2A for read/write DSP buffer status instead of 0xFF/0x7F. There is a known test case of a demo that {italic:requires} the card to return 0x7F/0xFF because it uses the last I/O read from the status port as the "zero reference" for it's music tracker and will produce crackling distorted audio if given 0xAA/0x2A: {weblink:url=https://www.pouet.net/prod.php?which=4219,text=Hysteric Overload by Hysteria
